articles.title: 2 New Mexico inmates win honors in prison writing contest
articles.description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (AP) — Two New Mexico prison inmates have won honors in the prestigious PEN America's Prison Writing Contest .

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: 2 New Mexico inmates win honors in prison writing contest
articles.description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (AP) — Two New Mexico prison inmates have won honors in the prestigious PEN America’s Prison Writing Contest. The organization announced in November that Dominic Murphy, convicted in 2005 of first-degree murder, took second place for poetry.…

articles.author: Elise Schmelzer elise.schmelzer@trib.com
articles.title: Private prison company pursuing Wyoming immigration detention center has troubled past
articles.description: Leaders in southwest Wyoming appear willing to overlook the troubled history of a private prison company attempting to build an immigration detention facility outside Evanston in order to bring what they say the community needs most — jobs and revenue.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Officials try to stop spread of chickenpox in state prison
articles.description: CHAPARRAL, N.M. (AP) — State officials say two inmates at a southern New Mexico prison have come down with chickenpox, and authorities are trying to limit the varicella virus that causes illness from spreading any further. A New Mexico Corrections Department …

articles.title: Officials try to stop spread of chickenpox in state prison
articles.description: CHAPARRAL, N.M. (AP) — State officials say two inmates at a southern New Mexico prison have come down with chickenpox, and authorities are trying to limit the varicella virus that causes illness from spreading any further.

articles.author: Jonathan Blitzer
articles.title: Mothers in a New Mexico Prison Do Not Know How to Find Their Children
articles.description: Jonathan Blitzer writes about migrant women detained in a county jail in New Mexico who have been unable to find the children whom they were separated from.

articles.author: Noor Al-Sibai
articles.title: Immigrant moms still have no idea how to find their kids after Trump ripped them away
articles.description: In spite of Donald Trump’s executive order ending his “zero tolerance” policy separating families at the US-Mexico border, there remain mothers separated from their children who have no idea where their kids are. In interviews with The New Yorker, women detai…

articles.author: Catherine E. Shoichet, CNN
articles.title: Surprise inspections find 'significant issues' in treatment of ICE detainees
articles.description: Long waits for medical care and inappropriate treatment of detainees are among issues found at several US immigrant detention facilities, a new report says.

articles.author: Kevin Gosztola
articles.title: Widespread Detainee Abuse At ICE Prisons Confirmed By Inspector General Report
articles.description: The inspector general for the Homeland Security Department conducted unannounced inspections of six immigrant detention facilities overseen by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). It uncovered glaring examples of detainee abuse and mistreatment at four …

articles.title: 42 more Indians detained for illegally entering USA
articles.description: The Indian missions have been provided with names of the detained people in Oregon and New Mexico.

articles.author: Michael Daly
articles.title: One Baby Abuser Was Put Away. One Was Left to Mass Murder.
articles.description: The Air Force had other things to deal with, and Airman Devin Patrick Kelley escaped with a one-year sentence.

articles.author: John Burnett
articles.title: The U.S. Has A Long, Troubled History Of Detaining Families Together
articles.description: Now that President Trump no longer can separate migrant families detained at the border, his administration is preparing to lock them up together — an arrangement with many critics and legal limits.

articles.title: The Asylum Seekers Who ICE Locked Up For No Reason

articles.title: Watchdog Agency Issues Report on ICE Abuse as Agency Seeks to Acquire New Detention Centers
articles.description: ICE's abuse record speaks for itself. It needs oversight, not more places to lock people up. This week, the watchdog agency for the Department of Homeland Security issued a damning new report examining Immigration and Custom Enforcement’s operation of five im…

articles.author: Jonathan Blitzer
articles.title: How the Humanitarian Crisis on the Mexico Border Could Worse
articles.description: Federal prosecutors are dropping criminal charges against migrants detained at the southern border, but the shift to civil proceedings will cost detainees access to the lawyers who are helping them locate their children.

articles.title: Wanted polygamist free after 15 years on the lam in Mexico - Laredo Morning Times
articles.description: PHOENIX (AP) - A polygamist who fled to Mexico about 15 years ago with his wives and kids while facing child molestation charges in Arizona is now free after the charges were dropped months ago. Orson William Black Jr. was arrested by Mexican authorities in t…

articles.title: Four years of Dateline's Missing in America: 90 still missing
articles.description: Read, and share, their stories. Someone, somewhere, saw something. If you know someone who is missing, send us a message on Facebook or email dateline.contactus.@nbcuni.com.
